instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2532: What is 820-2532? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..

threads.title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
threads.message: I am a Litle confused  because I see the POWER RAILS but I don know which has to be present before and after turning on the machine I know  some voltage is Always-Present but which one not?

threads.title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
threads.message: G3H rails are always present. S5 rails are present with AC connected. The rest will come on as the macbook turns on first S4 then S3 and last S0. Once S0 is present the very last voltage will be CPU Vcore to come high.

threads.title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
threads.message:
No Title

Thanks for your answer I ask these because I have one Mac book pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> I have PP3V3 S5 but I don’t have PP5V S5 and both came from the same IC but I don have short to ground in the coil L7220 and I don’t know if I have to make another post for these question?

threads.title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
threads.message: L7220 is the 5V power supply and is a S3 rail. Common problem on these boards is <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>. What is the voltage on <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>? Are you using a REAL Apple 85W charger?

check the picture is a small coil burn L3405 and that one suppose to have <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> and like you say is goin to be present after the mac turn it on So something el is missing can you tell me what I have to check next because I have the voltage on

threads.title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
threads.message:
L3405 burned because of a short in the cable to the airport card or airport card in LCD they plugged it in upside down. L3405 has no effect on the power on of the board.

<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> present? Green light present?

threads.title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
threads.message: Yes I have <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 3.3v and Read Ligth Present what other signals I have to check  and how I have  know the signals What I have to follow  In pc is easy to me I check the signals in KBC I know there what I have to do but apple is totally different  I am a little confused

threads.title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> toggling when you press the power button? <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3_RTC</SIGNAL> present? 32kHz present on Y2810?

threads.title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
threads.message: MCP is now a primary suspect, SMC is next. I assume you checked all rails for shorts?
